header.title: Instructions for the Apache Ant Task

section.title: Introduction
section.p: This page describes how to generate barcodes inside Ant scripts.

section.title: Using the Ant task

Then you're set to produce barcodes. Here's an example:
This creates an UPC-E symbol with the message "1234567" in SVG format and saves the generated image as "mybarcode.svg".
The Ant tasks supports the following attributes/parameters:

tr.td: The symbology to use. Use one of the supported symbology identifiers such as "code128", "datamatrix" etc. These are the same as on the command-line interface.
Yes, if you don't specify a configuration file.
Allows you to specify an XML configuration file (Barcode XML format) in order to configure the barcode generator.
Yes, if you don't specify a symbology.
The requested output format. You can either use a MIME type (such as "image/png") or a format identifier (such as "png").
The resolution (in dots per inch) for the generated images. Only applicable when generating bitmap formats.
Indicates whether to generate monochrome (black and white, 1 bit) bitmap images. Only applicable when generating bitmap formats.

section.note: The "symbol" and "configurationFile" attributes are mutually exclusive! If you specify both, "configuration" is ignored.
